--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Derek James" <djames@g...> wrote:
> So it seems to me that you can't logically separate the end result 
> from the evolving topologies.  If there's waste at the end, there 
> was waste throughout.
> 

While this is true, I think the important point is the opposite: 
just because there is a nice final topology does not mean that you 
didn't waste a lot of time on overly complicated ones along the way.

Your point, i.e. that an imperfect final topology implies an 
imperfect search, is true as well, but doesn't really say anything 
that people weren't already saying.  What people didn't talk about 
before was my point above, that just because their final XOR network 
looks pretty doesn't mean they have a good algorithm.

ken
